title: Aid for a Single Mother of 8 Near the Frontline
subtitle: One mother's courage — raising 8 children alone while holding onto love and hope amidst war
introduction: In the village of Mykolaivka in Eastern Ukraine lives a family filled with love and resilience. Mother Oksana raises 8 children alone — 4 biological and 4 adopted from an orphanage years ago. She has organized this family with love, ensuring every child feels needed and cherished.

Father Ihor served in the 92nd Separate Mechanized Brigade. He went missing at the front lines (actually killed in action). Because he is officially listed as 'missing' rather than 'killed,' the family cannot receive any government benefits.

This is their fourth home. Due to proximity to the front lines, they may need to relocate again at any moment. Basic necessities are covered, but the children's educational and developmental needs remain unmet.

father.name: Ihor
father.description: Missing at the front (no pension due to 'missing' status)

livingConditions.title: Living Conditions
livingConditions.description: The 5 boys share one room with bunk beds, while the 3 girls share another. Despite limited space, each child has found their own little corner.
points: Basic survival needs are met (food, hygiene supplies provided)
House needs repairs but they cannot afford them
Uncertain how long they can stay due to proximity to front lines

childrenTalents.title: Children's Talents
childrenTalents.description: The children are very talented, especially in drawing. Mother Oksana herself is creative and always encourages and supports the children's interests.

adoptionStory.title: The Adoption Story
adoptionStory.content: A few years ago, during a visit to an orphanage, mother Oksana decided to give those children a real family. All adopted children have found safety in this home, gaining love and a sense of belonging. She has organized family life remarkably well, ensuring every child feels needed and happy.

whyGifts.title: Why Aid These Supplies
reasons: Basic needs (food, heating) are already covered
Near the front lines with unstable housing
Books, educational toys, and learning materials are most needed
Helps children preserve their childhood despite war
whyGifts.conclusion: This is the most practical and meaningful way to help.

callToAction.title: They Are Waiting to Be Seen
callToAction.content: This family lost their father, has been forced to relocate multiple times, has extremely limited resources, yet still holds onto love, dignity, unity, and hope for the future. Their strength comes from mutual respect, talent and creativity, and strong family bonds.
callToAction.closing: These 8 children - 4 biological, 4 adopted - are all waiting for a future where they are seen, remembered, and treated with kindness.
